meanings.definition: to dissect (an animal or plant) to study its internal structure
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully anatomized the frog to learn about its insides.
meanings.sent2: The biology students anatomized the flower to understand its parts.
meanings.sent3: The curious child wanted to anatomize the toy to see how it worked.
meanings.sent4: She decided to anatomize the problem, breaking it down into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to anatomize the crime scene to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: to analyze or examine in great detail
meanings.sent1: The researcher anatomized the data to find patterns.
meanings.sent2: She likes to anatomize every decision before making a choice.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to anatomize the recipe to improve it.
meanings.sent4: He would anatomize every word of the contract before signing.
meanings.sent5: The artist would anatomize each brushstroke to perfect the painting.
